answers.answer:
There are several ways to enter Romania: with temporary protection, with the right of short-stay, or as an asylum seeker.

To find more detailed information, you can refer to the beginning of the provided summary where these entry methods are listed. For extensive details on "temporary protection," read the sections that follow, which cover who can benefit, how it's granted, rights, obligations, and validity.

For extensive details on "temporary protection," read the sections that follow, which cover who can benefit, how it's granted, rights, obligations, and validity. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Temporary protection in Romania is available to Ukrainian citizens who lived in Ukraine before February 24, 2022, and their family members. It also applies to non-Ukrainian nationals or stateless persons who had international or national protection in Ukraine, or legal permanent residency in Ukraine and cannot safely return to their home country.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage under the section "Temporary protection" and then specifically "Who can benefit from temporary protection?".
answers.bResponse:
Temporary protection in Romania is available to Ukrainian citizens who lived in Ukraine before February 24, 2022, and their family members. It also applies to non-Ukrainian nationals or stateless persons who had international or national protection in Ukraine, or legal permanent residency in Ukraine and cannot safely return to their home country.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage under the section "Temporary protection" and then specifically "Who can benefit from temporary protection?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Yes, individuals can choose the European Union country where they wish to receive temporary protection. They can benefit from these rights in any EU country that issues them a residency permit.

To find more detailed information, go to the webpage and read under the section titled "Can I decide the country where I want to benefit from temporary protection?".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, individuals can choose the European Union country where they wish to receive temporary protection. They can benefit from these rights in any EU country that issues them a residency permit.

To find more detailed information, go to the webpage and read under the section titled "Can I decide the country where I want to benefit from temporary protection?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Beneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania are granted rights including the right to stay, access to information, the right to work, engage in educational activities, receive financial assistance if needed, access medical care, and for minors, access to the national education system. These rights also extend to family reunification, social services, and accommodation assistance.

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection` and read under the sections "What are my rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection?", "The right to work", "The right for education", "Medical assistance", "Reuniting families", "Social services", and "Accommodation".
answers.bResponse:

These rights also extend to family reunification, social services, and accommodation assistance.

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection` and read under the sections "What are my rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection?", "The right to work", "The right for education", "Medical assistance", "Reuniting families", "Social services", and "Accommodation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Individuals with temporary protection in Romania are obligated to respect the legislation in force, including laws concerning the legal status of foreigners.

To find this information, go to the provided summary and read under the section "What are my obligations as a beneficiary of temporary protection?".

answers.answer:
Temporary protection in Romania is valid until March 4, 2025.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection and read under the section "What is the validity period of temporary protection?".

answers.answer:
To register your residence in Romania, beneficiaries of temporary protection must either prove their address with documents such as a title deed, a registered rental contract, or a comodat contract, or simply declare their locality and county if no documents are available.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage by scrolling down to the section titled "Residence Permit" and then looking under the subsection "Residence Registration."

You can find this detailed information on the webpage by scrolling down to the section titled "Residence Permit" and then looking under the subsection "Residence Registration." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Yes, a person holding temporary protection in Romania can return to their country of origin, and the Romanian authorities will provide support for this procedure. As long as the temporary protection has not expired and conditions in their country of origin remain unchanged, they may request re-admittance to Romanian territory and continue to benefit from the temporary protection status.

To find this information on the webpage, navigate to the section titled "May I return to my country of origin?".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, a person holding temporary protection in Romania can return to their country of origin, and the Romanian authorities will provide support for this procedure. As long as the temporary protection has not expired and conditions in their country of origin remain unchanged, they may request re-admittance to Romanian territory and continue to benefit from the temporary protection status.

To find this information on the webpage, navigate to the section titled "May I return to my country of origin?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Temporary protection in Romania can be excluded if there are strong reasons to believe the individual has committed serious crimes against peace, war crimes, crimes against humanity, other serious crimes outside Romania prior to entry, acts against UN principles, or poses a danger to Romania's security or public order due to a serious crime conviction. It can be revoked if the beneficiary voluntarily waives their temporary protection status.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection and read under the sections titled "The exclusion from the temporary protection" and "Waiver of temporary protection".
answers.bResponse:
Temporary protection in Romania can be excluded if there are strong reasons to believe the individual has committed serious crimes against peace, war crimes, crimes against humanity, other serious crimes outside Romania prior to entry, acts against UN principles, or poses a danger to Romania's security or public order due to a serious crime conviction. It can be revoked if the beneficiary voluntarily waives their temporary protection status.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection and read under the sections titled "The exclusion from the temporary protection" and "Waiver of temporary protection". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
The authorities responsible for issuing residence permits for temporary protection in Romania are those available in temporary accommodation and humanitarian support camps or the centers of the General Inspectorate for Immigrations.

To find this information on the webpage, navigate to the section titled "The authorities that can issue the residency permit."
answers.bResponse:
The authorities responsible for issuing residence permits for temporary protection in Romania are those available in temporary accommodation and humanitarian support camps or the centers of the General Inspectorate for Immigrations.

To find this information on the webpage, navigate to the section titled "The authorities that can issue the residency permit." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
If you no longer wish to benefit from temporary protection in Romania, you can contact the General Inspectorate for Immigration if you are in Romania, or the Romanian diplomatic mission if you are in another country. After requesting a waiver, you will be informed to submit your document and will then be issued a certificate confirming the refusal.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage under the section titled "Waiver of temporary protection".

answers.answer:
Yes, there are specific provisions for employment for those with temporary protection in Romania. Beneficiaries have the right to be hired, perform freelance activities, and engage in vocational training, with no employment notice or visa required if they have a residence permit.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection` and read under the sections "What are my rigthts as a beneficiary of temporary protection?" and "The right to work".

answers.answer:
Children and students under temporary protection in Romania have access to the national education system, including early, primary, and secondary schools, under the same conditions as Romanian citizens, with additional support provided. Ukrainian citizens can also continue higher education, potentially benefiting from state funding and academic mobility.

To find detailed information, go to the website and read under the section "What are my rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection?", specifically the sub-section titled "The right for education".

answers.answer:
Yes, beneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania are entitled to medical assistance, including free primary and emergency medical care, and treatment for acute or chronic life-threatening illnesses. They also receive medical services, supplies, and medicines like insured Romanian citizens, without paying contributions or co-payments.

To find this information, go to the webpage and look under the sections titled "What are my rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection?" and "Medical assistance". You can also find related details under "Social services".
answers.bResponse:

They also receive medical services, supplies, and medicines like insured Romanian citizens, without paying contributions or co-payments.

To find this information, go to the webpage and look under the sections titled "What are my rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection?" and "Medical assistance". You can also find related details under "Social services". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Family members under temporary protection in different EU Member States can be reunited in Romania, taking into account their wishes. If family members are not yet in Romania, reunification can be requested for spouses, unmarried minor children, and parents or other responsible adults of minor, unmarried beneficiaries, provided they need protection.

To find more detailed information, go to the website and read under the section "Reuniting families".
answers.bResponse:
Family members under temporary protection in different EU Member States can be reunited in Romania, taking into account their wishes. If family members are not yet in Romania, reunification can be requested for spouses, unmarried minor children, and parents or other responsible adults of minor, unmarried beneficiaries, provided they need protection.

To find more detailed information, go to the website and read under the section "Reuniting families". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Individuals with temporary protection in Romania are entitled to financial support, free primary and emergency medical care, access to the national education system, employment rights, and support for family reunification. Within temporary accommodation camps, they also receive food, clothing, and personal hygiene products.

To find detailed information, go to the website and read under the sections "What are my rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection?", "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection", "The right to work", "The right for education", "Medical assistance", "Reuniting families", "Social services", and "Accommodation".

For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
While there is no direct financial support for renting a home, accommodation is provided in temporary camps, and individuals and legal entities hosting those with temporary protection can receive reimbursement for daily accommodation and food expenses. Additionally, support for finding temporary accommodation is available through resources like "Un Acoperiș".

You can find this detailed information on the webpage by looking under the section titled "Accommodation".

answers.answer:
To get temporary protection in Romania, you must be on Romanian territory or at a border crossing point and contact the authorities in charge. When you present yourself, your photo will be taken, and personal data will be recorded, after which you will be issued a residency permit.

For more detailed information, you can read the "How is temporary protection granted?" and "The authorities that can issue the residency permit" sections on the webpage.
answers.bResponse:

For more detailed information, you can read the "How is temporary protection granted?" and "The authorities that can issue the residency permit" sections on the webpage. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer:
Residence permits issued before the new government decision remain valid during the application of Decision (EU) 382/2022, but beneficiaries have 180 days from the decision's entry into force to request their replacement.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the section "Residence Permit".
